title: How to go to the addons.mozilla.org page from the addon page in about:addons?
content:
Let's say, I have an addon in about:addons, in this case, Youtube Playlist.

So, let's say I've forgotten what it's about, and I therefore want to read more about it in its page in addons.mozilla.org ; since all addons for (normal) Firefox now have to be signed by Mozilla, I assume that the addon therefore *must* have an addons.mozilla.org page.

However, I haven't found a button or anything that would tell me "Go to addons homepage" or something.

Now before you tell me "just search the internet", I did, and I cannot find an addon called "Youtube Playlist" in search engines - I found something called "YouTube Playlist Helper", but it is not the same one.

So, is there such a facility in about:addons of Firefox?
creator: sdbbs

title: Line spacing in FireFox menus
content: To the Mozilla team: Please give us back control over the line spacing in the drop down menus. When you have lots of items it is very annoying to have to scroll down several pages. The temporary fix with "browser.proton.contextmenus.enabled" was working very nicely. Why not leave it? Thanks.

title: Unable to use Fido key for Microsoft Account
content: I set up my Fido2 key to work with my Microsoft account on Windows, but when I tried using it on Linux, I noticed that the option to sign in with security key is missing altogether, I tried using Edge and that worked fine, so it should be something regarding Firefox, please advise. I do have security.webauth.webauthn_enable_softtoken set to true and I can log it with it on Yubikey's demo site, so my only guess it Firefox didn't report the flag that's required to log in with security key for Microsoft accounts?
creator: Eric_Ou

title: Delete Firefox sync account after email change
content:
Hi,

during maintenance of my logins in my password manager I discovered that I still have the login data for a FireFox Sync account. I can login to that account and see my settings, but I actually want to delete the account completely. The problem: The mail address associated with that account does not exist anymore (changed the company). When trying to delete the account (or when trying to add a seconday mail address), Firefox Sync prompts me to enter a verification code that was sent by mail.

I'll never receive that code, as that original mail adress does not exist anymore.

How can I delete that FS Sync account?

Thanks, Frank
